WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
Errors and warnings (are there warnings?) are reported in the wrong format.
They are reported in for example the following format:

C:/Users/serge/Documents/My Web Sites/NodeStarterSite/Raytracer.ts (6,27): Expected ';'

I have a few issues with this:

1. I can't determine if this line is an error, warning or just an informational message
2. The error format is not in the MSBuild error format (described in http://blogs.msdn.com/b/msbuild/archive/2006/11/03/msbuild-visual-studio-aware-error-messages-and-message-formats.aspx)
3. Why is there a space between filename and (line,column), in above example: Raytracer.ts (6,27): 

All my output parsing code looking for MSBuild format messages or even just the word error or warning does not work anymore!

Comments.Message: Forgot one thing: filename is reported with forward slashes, on Windows backward slashes are used... Don't know the best way to handle that...
